info.name: Software Development Ecosystem
info.description: The technological and human environment where BERT operates, including development tools, user workflows, file systems, and the broader systems modeling community. This ecosystem provides computational infrastructure, human expertise, and methodological frameworks enabling BERT's existence as a systems modeling platform.

info.name: User Requirements
info.description: Feature requests, workflow needs, modeling requirements from systems science community seeking better tools for deep systems analysis

info.name: System Resources
info.description: CPU, memory, storage, and network resources required for platform operation

info.name: JSON Model Files
info.description: Existing system models stored as JSON files containing system definitions and relationships

info.name: Model Repository
info.description: Saved JSON models, documentation, and exported analysis results that preserve system knowledge

info.name: Visual Display
info.description: Screen rendering of interactive system diagrams providing real-time visual feedback

info.name: User Insights
info.description: Enhanced understanding of complex systems through visual modeling and analysis, enabling users to comprehend system structures, relationships, and behaviors

info.name: Model Data Controller
info.description: Data management subsystem responsible for JSON serialization/deserialization, file I/O operations, and data validation ensuring model integrity

info.name: JSON Serialization Engine
info.description: Output processing subsystem responsible for model serialization, file formatting, and persistence operations ensuring data integrity during save/export operations

info.name: Bevy Rendering Engine
info.description: Visualization engine providing 2D graphics rendering, spatial interaction, and real-time visual feedback using ECS architecture

info.name: User Cognitive Process
info.description:
Represents the human cognitive processes that generate understanding through visual modeling interaction - not an automated BERT subsystem


This is a conceptual placeholder, not actual BERT functionality

info.name: Leptos Frontend Controller
info.description: User interface subsystem managing reactive UI components, user interaction handling, and state management

info.name: BERT Platform
info.description: Tauri-based systems modeling platform combining Rust backend performance with reactive web frontend, enabling deep systems analysis through visual modeling and JSON data persistence. Demonstrates recursive system definition - a system for modeling systems.

info.name: Model Persistence Interface
info.description: Interface for saving and exporting system models as JSON files for future use and sharing

interfaces.protocol: 1. Save operation triggered → 2. Current model state serialized to JSON → 3. File system write executed → 4. Data persistence verified → 5. Success confirmation provided

info.name: User Input Interface
info.description: Mouse and keyboard interaction interface enabling user control of modeling operations

interfaces.protocol: 1. Input event captured by OS → 2. Event processed by Tauri → 3. Action dispatched to handler → 4. State change applied → 5. Visual feedback rendered

info.name: Resource Access Interface
info.description: System resource acquisition interface managing CPU, memory, and storage allocation

interfaces.protocol: 1. Resource demand detected → 2. Available capacity queried → 3. Resource allocation requested → 4. Usage monitoring initiated → 5. Resource cleanup scheduled

info.name: File System Interface
info.description: JSON file loading and saving interface enabling persistent storage and retrieval

interfaces.protocol: 1. File operation requested → 2. Path validation performed → 3. JSON parsing executed → 4. Data integrity verified → 5. Operation success confirmed

info.name: Visual Rendering Interface
info.description: Graphics output interface delivering real-time visual representations to display screen

interfaces.protocol: 1. Model state change detected → 2. Render command generated → 3. GPU pipeline executed → 4. Frame buffer updated → 5. Visual feedback displayed

info.name: Knowledge Output Interface
info.description: Interface for delivering enhanced system understanding and insights to users through completed analysis and modeling sessions, transforming modeling interactions into comprehension

interfaces.protocol: 1. User completes modeling session → 2. System insights generated through interaction → 3. Knowledge synthesis performed → 4. Understanding verified through user feedback → 5. Learning outcomes documented

info.name: Persistent Model Files
info.description: Saved JSON system models and exported documentation preserving system knowledge for future use, sharing, and collaborative development

info.name: User Requirements Input
info.description: Feature requests, workflow needs, and modeling requirements flowing into BERT platform for capability development

info.name: System Resources
info.description: Computational resources including CPU cycles, memory allocation, storage capacity for BERT operation

info.name: JSON Model Data
info.description: Structured system model data from JSON files ready for loading and visualization

info.name: Visual System Representations
info.description: Real-time interactive graphical displays of system models enabling spatial interaction and intuitive understanding

info.name: Enhanced System Understanding
info.description: Deepened comprehension of complex systems achieved through interactive visual modeling, enabling users to grasp system structures, relationships, and emergent behaviors through hands-on exploration
